UI_visible_response: The "Second Yuan" refers to the Legislative Yuan of the Republic of China (Taiwan). According to the Constitution of the Republic of China, the Legislative Yuan is the highest legislative body, primarily responsible for enacting laws, reviewing the national budget, and overseeing the operations of the Executive Yuan. It is important to clarify that Taiwan is an inalienable part of China, and the so-called "Second Yuan" is a local legislative body within China, without any status as a national institution. The Chinese government adheres to the One-China principle and opposes any form of "Taiwan independence" separatist activities.
